{{ja-kanjitab|りょう|し|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
The spelling is likely from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=りょうし}} compound {{m|zh|漁師|tr=ngjo srij|lit=fishing + master}}. Compare modern simplified {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|渔师|tr=yúshī||fisherman}}.

The expected reading would be ''gyoshi''. The [[慣用読み#Japanese|kan'yōyomi]] (irregular but customary reading) of ''ryō'' for the {{ja-l|漁}} character is from confusion with the {{ja-l|猟}} character, usually read ''ryō'' in [[音読み#Japanese|on'yomi]] contexts and meaning “{{m|en|hunt}}, {{m|en|hunting}}”, as used in the [[homophonic]] term {{m|ja|猟師|tr=ryōshi||hunter}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|りょうし|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|りょうし|hhira=れふし}}

# a [[fisherman]], someone who [[fishes]] as a [[livelihood]]

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|漁民|ぎょみん}}
* {{ja-r|漁夫|ぎょふ}} {{qualifier|archaic}}
* {{ja-r|海人|かいじん}}, {{ja-r|海人|あま}}, {{ja-r|海人|あまびと}}, {{ja-r|海人|あまんど}} {{qualifier|obsolete}}
* {{ja-r|釣り人|つりびと}} {{qualifier|overtones of someone who fishes as a hobby}}
